profiles:
Summary Applications engineering professional with 10 years of experience. Superb collaboration, product development, customer service, presentation, facilitation, and problem resolution skills. Recognized for an ability to define, support, market, and launch new technical products and services that drive results and increase market share. Specialties:• Versatile as a project team lead or team member delivering part of a solution  
• Excellent problem solving and project organization skills  
• Strong verbal and written communication skills  
• Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications Suite 
• Skilled in use of Adobe FrameMaker 
• Frequent user of SharePoint and Live Meeting collaboration tools 
• Experience using Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Premiere, and Windows Movie Maker Summary Applications engineering professional with 10 years of experience. • Experience using Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Premiere, and Windows Movie Maker Experience Field Applications Engineer Intel Corporation May 2011  – Present (4 years 4 months) Field Applications Engineer supporting Best Buy. Senior Platform Applications Engineer - PC Client Operations and Enabling Intel July 1999  –  May 2011  (11 years 11 months) Provide technical support and marketing input for Intel’s mobile and desktop processors from product definition through product launch and sustaining. Collaborate with product marketing, architecture, and engineering teams to define, enable, and debug new product features and technologies.  
 
• Chair of a technical workgroup to define and approve power/thermal specifications for new products on Intel’s processor roadmap. Workgroup includes senior contributors from marketing, business development, architecture, engineering, and product quality/reliability. 
• Collaborate with marketing, architecture, and product engineering to drive approval of lower power processor products. These actions help ensure Intel’s ability to meet new Energy Star guidelines, reduce system design costs for market competitiveness, and save end users money for power costs.  
• Drove closure of 2009 desktop platforms system power supply guidance. This effort saved customers money and time in power supply redesign. Coordinated communications of specification changes, technical implications, and presented requirements to Intel customers worldwide.  
• Appointed as Intel Applications Engineering Platform Manager for 2007 to track division-wide product and customer issues, present status and resolution plans to management while driving closure, and ensure a successful platform launch for Intel’s customers. 
• Collaborate across Intel divisions to define technical specifications for next generation desktop processors spanning from product definition through product launch. 
• Received multiple Intel Divisional Recognition Awards for outstanding customer support and new technology enabling.  
• Current and past author and document owner of technical datasheets for six generations of Intel desktop processors. Coordinated updates across divisions for specifications where synergies were discovered. Summary I currently work as an Applications engineer for Intel Corporation after holding a similar position at Avago/LSI. I have an M.S. in Electrical Engineering with an Analog Design concentration from Santa Clara University and received my B.S. in Electrical Engineering from the University of California Santa Barbara. 
 
My main responsibilities consist of customer support, hardware testing, and some circuit simulation. Customer issues are debugged either on site or remotely. Hardware testing done mostly in lab on test chips using available lab equipment. Some simulation to silicon correlation comparing simulated link performance to actual silicon performance. Experience Applications Engineer Intel Corporation November 2014  – Present (10 months) Testing, debugging, and review of customer's networking SerDes. PCIe, Ethernet, USB, 10G-KR, and other various standards. Some channel simulation with most testing being done hands-on in the lab using bench equipment. Senior SerDes Applications/Validation Engineer LSI Corporation January 2012  –  November 2014  (2 years 11 months) San Jose, CA Bench testing and simulation of customer hardware applications. I'm responsible for delivering and supporting our products within customer systems. Circuit debug, hardware and software support, data processing, and discussion of customer issues. I also provide internal support and run bench validation tests of SerDes test chips. Equipment used includes BERTscopes, oscilloscopes, power supplies, temperature controllers, and various backplanes. Software primarily in Python with data collected and processed in Excel. Hardware Validation Engineer LSI Corporation December 2010  –  January 2012  (1 year 2 months) SerDes Validation lab testing chips to see if they meet standard specifications. Receiver jitter tolerance, transmitter amplitude, PLL functionality, etc. characterized running automated tests via Python scripts. Product Support Engineer One Touch Systems January 2006  –  December 2010  (5 years) - Developed and maintained lab facilities to emulate customers’ network environments and resolved issues reported via email and phone support lines. 
- Troubleshooting of software, hardware products installed in IP/satellite networks. 
- Analysis & troubleshooting of SQL & MS Access type databases. 
- Windows Server 2000/2003 & IIS configuration. 
- Coordinated with Business Development Managers and Account Executives to help facilitate the installation, upgrade of new products at customer locations. 
- Deliver product training at customer facilities and internally to sales group.
